comments.content: What are you wanting to embed the fonts into? PDFs? HTML? Marble?

Good point ,) / We would like to embed the fonts into HTML. As it is done here at typophile:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173948im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/screen-capture-1_4207.png)

Typophile’s solution is similar to (based on?) [sIFR](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173948/http:/www.mikeindustries.com/sifr).  
There’s a [discussion](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706173948/http:/typophile.com/node/35077) about it.
sIFR is pretty much the only sane way to do it these days. It’s not really embedding in HTML, of course, but via Flash. Same end-result, though, for the most part.
